security: The document contains personal information about David Reed Fromer, including his Social Security number, date of birth, and place of birth. Releasing this information could violate his privacy.
summary: A local agency check conducted on David Reed Fromer in 1966 revealed that, as a child, he was mentioned in a 1954 People's World article for asking why American children couldn't send pictures to Russian children.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 2, 1966, a local agency check was performed on David Reed Fromer by Casual Source A-16 in Oakland, California. The investigation found a reference to Fromer in a January 27, 1954, edition of the People's World, where he, as an 11-year-old student in San Francisco, California, questioned why American children couldn't exchange pictures with Russian children after watching a film about Russian schoolchildren. The check was initiated by the 115th MI Group (I) and signed by Special Agent Marvin P. Schmidt.
title: Local Agency Check on David Reed Fromer
